name: Space of Mine
description:
Space of Mine

Rebel against a space mining AI hive and advance through as many weapons and upgrades as possible before the horde of security ships ends you with a bang. What, you expected to just mine?

Made for Juice Jam, 2022

Destroy enemy ships to gather progress points, install the chosen upgrade and choose the next one. New enemies appear in next waves and they sure aren't happy with value drifters.

From now on, my new rule of thumb: don't develop a game that takes more than 2 days for a week-long game jam. Seriously, crunching ain't healthy, boys and girls. Still, the game leaves a lot to be desired, content-wise, juiciness-wise and balancing-wise, but still is a fun and somewhat juicy experience. I liked making a shader for asteroid rendering a lot, despite it being quite simple.

Credits

Alex "Solawk" Khanov – Game Design, Programming, Graphics
Nicknamed – Graphics

Some sounds are taken or originate from Warframe and Battleships Forever

Music:

"Boss Hunter", "Afterburners", "Killstealer", "Night Squad", "Stalker", "Boneyard", "Running From Demons" by Waterflame
Cynematic – "Legacy", Waeys & Smetvrees – "Icarus Fell" by Ninety9Lives

Late Night Radio by Kevin MacLeod
Link: https://incompetech.filmmusic.io/song/7613-late-night-radio
